intro: Ageratum echioides, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 30 inches and features narrow, gray-green leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with white centers, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden borders and containers.
